article_title: GOP Rep Thinks U.S. Foreign Policy Focuses Too Much On Abortion, LGBT Rights
article_text:
Syrian Schoolchildren Russell Watkins/Department for International Development

An 11-year-old refugee at school in Lebanon, where aid is helping provide education to thousands of children.

Girls in Senegal DFID

The UK is committed to helping end the practice of Female Genital Mutilation.

Typhoon Victims Jess Seldon/Department for International Development

A four-year-old boy gets a vital measles injection with UK funding.

Angelo Russell Watkins/Department for International Development

British physiotherapist Peter Skelton tries to make friends with five-year-old Angelo, who suffered severe, life-changing injuries when Typhoon Haiyan.

Central African Republic Juliette Humble/DFID

A British aid plane arrives in CAR, where charities say " ethnic cleansing " of Muslims has taken place.

The Remains Of Tacloban Henry Donati/Department for International Development

A man stands surrounded by the devastation wrought by Typhoon Haiyan.

Landmine Clearance DFID

Hazardous work in Mozambique

Child Refugees David Brunetti/ Doctors of the World

A mother watches on as her child is examined by a medic in Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan.

Refugees In Iraq WFP/Dina El-Kassaby

Aid at the Domiz camp comes in the form of food vouchers for desperate families.

article_metadata.description: Rep. Chris Smith (R-N.J.) said in a radio interview last week that U.S. foreign policy under President Barack Obama focuses too much on abortion and LGBT...
